description: Chance and probability, experimental vs theoretical probability, expressing probability as fractions, decimals and percentages.

concepts.name: Simple Probability
concepts.description: Calculating probability of single events, expressing as fractions
common_misconceptions: Confusing number of outcomes with probability
Forgetting probability must be between 0 and 1
question_patterns: A bag contains {X} red, {Y} blue, {Z} green marbles. What is the probability of drawing a {colour}?
A spinner has {N} equal sections. What is the probability of landing on {section}?
example_stems: A bag has 5 red, 3 blue, and 2 green marbles. What is the probability of picking a blue marble?
A fair dice is rolled. What is the probability of getting an even number?

concepts.name: Combined Events
concepts.description: Probability involving multiple conditions or combined outcomes
question_patterns: What is the probability of drawing a card that is {condition1} AND {condition2}?
What is the probability of getting {outcome1} OR {outcome2}?
example_stems: From a standard deck, what is the probability of drawing a red King?
What is the probability of rolling a number less than 3 OR greater than 5?

concepts.name: Probability Representations
concepts.description: Converting between fractions, decimals, percentages for probability
question_patterns: Express the probability {fraction} as a percentage.
Which of these shows the same probability: {options}?
example_stems: The probability of rain is 3/5. What is this as a percentage?
Which is greater: 40% chance or probability of 3/8?

concepts.name: Experimental Probability
concepts.description: Using experimental results to estimate probability
common_misconceptions: Expecting experimental to exactly match theoretical
Not using correct total for denominator
question_patterns: In {N} trials, {event} occurred {X} times. What is the experimental probability?
Based on the results, estimate the probability of {event}.
example_stems: A coin was flipped 50 times and landed heads 28 times. What is the experimental probability of heads?
In 100 spins, the spinner landed on red 35 times. Estimate the probability of red.
